title: How to add new compiler entry on Cray platform?  (TypeError: sequence item 2: expected string, NoneType found)
body:
Spack auto-detects cray compilers/programming-environemnt and generate `$HOME/cray/compilers.yaml`. This works fine.

Now I would like create new environment (with additional modules) which has say `PrgEnv-intel` and `perftools` module also loaded. (typically for profiling code etc). So I created  `~/.spack/compilers.yaml` as:

```
 compilers.yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-intel
    - perftools
    - !!python/unicode 'intel/17.0.0.098'
    operating_system: CNL
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    spec: intel@18
    target: any
```

Say `intel@18` is new spec /version. Now I want to use it as:

```
$ spack -d install hdf %intel@18
==> Reading config file /gpfs/mira-home/kumbhar/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
==> Reading config file /home/kumbhar/.spack/cray/packages.yaml

  File "/gpfs/mira-home/kumbhar/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/module_file_generation.py", line 32, in post_install
    generator.write()
  File "/gpfs/mira-home/kumbhar/spack/lib/spack/spack/modules.py", line 398, in write
    set_module_variables_for_package(self.pkg, self.pkg.module)
  File "/gpfs/mira-home/kumbhar/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 349, in set_module_variables_for_package
    m.std_cmake_args = spack.CMakePackage._std_args(pkg)
  File "/gpfs/mira-home/kumbhar/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/cmake.py", line 116, in _std_args
    rpaths = ':'.join(spack.build_environment.get_rpaths(pkg))
TypeError: sequence item 2: expected string, NoneType found
```

Is it possible to create such mix environments on Cray system? Or is this a bug?
